ca.mcgill.ecse211.project
Class Navigation

java.lang.Object
  ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.Navigation

public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Object

This class takes care of the robot navigation. It controls the movement by implementing movement, turning, distance & angle methods.

          The corrected X coordinate (the exact location where the robot is).

Constructor Detail

Navigation

public Navigation(Odometer odometer,
                  EV3LargeRegulatedMotor leftMotor,
                  EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor,
                  EV3LargeRegulatedMotor ziplineMotor,
                  EV3LargeRegulatedMotor ulMotor)
The constructor for the Navigation that initializes the 3 motors as well as the odometer.

Parameters:
odometer - pointer to the Odometer
leftMotor - pointer to the left motor
rightMotor - pointer to the right motor
ziplineMotor - pointer to the zipline motor
Method Detail

doZipline

void doZipline(double distance)
This method performs the Zipline traversal. by making the robot gowing towards the start point. It then starts the zipline motor to traverse the river.

Parameters:
distance - the total length of the zipline.

doZipline

public void doZipline(double x,
                      double y,
                      double zipdistance,
                      double travelDis)
This methods performs the zipline traversal by firstly going to the input target coordinates (start of the zipline).

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate for the start of the zipline.
y - the y coordinate for the start of the zipline.
zipdistance - the distance of the zipline.

securityTurn

void securityTurn()
This method permits the robot to performs a security turn before a midpoint localization to make sure it gets the first line.

onZipline

boolean onZipline()
This method is to know if the robot is traversing the zipline.

Returns:
true if the robot is currently on the zipline and false otherwise.

travelTo

public boolean travelTo(double x,
                        double y)
This method makes the robot to travel to a specific location (x,y) From the current direction and the coordinates to go to, it calculates the angle to go to, then calls the turnTo method to face the target point and then travels to this point.

Parameters:
x - The x-coordinate of the destination point.
y - The y-coordinate of the destination point.
Returns:
Whether the robot arrived to its target destination or stopped at midpoint to allow localization.

goToOrigin

void goToOrigin(double x,
                double y)
This method is used before the first localization to go to the "origin" point (its not always (0;0) because it depends on the starting corner.

Parameters:
x - The x-coordinate of the destination point.
y - The y-coordinate of the destination point.

turnTo

public void turnTo(double theta)
This method makes the robot face the wanted angle direction from the current direction.

Parameters:
theta - the target direction.

makeTurn

void makeTurn(double theta,
              boolean isMin,
              boolean immediate)
This method makes the robot turn theta degrees.

Parameters:
theta - angle of rotation

rotateUltraMotor

void rotateUltraMotor(int deg,
                      boolean back)
This method rotates the motor connected to the ultrasonic sensor to perform flag detection.

Parameters:
back - boolean to know if we turn on the right or on the left.

isNavigating

boolean isNavigating()
This method return true if both motors are moving or the robot is traveling or is turning

Returns:
whether the motors are moving

motorMoveForward

public void motorMoveForward()
This method makes the motors move forward.

motorMoveBackward

public void motorMoveBackward(double distance)
This method makes the motors move backwards for a fixed distance.

Parameters:
distance - the distance for the motor to move.

motorStop

public void motorStop()
This method stops the robot from moving by setting the speed of motors to zero.

getPosition

void getPosition(Odometer odometer)
This method get current odometer readings and populates the data to the class fields nowX, nowY, nowTheta.

Parameters:
odometer - the odometer object

convertDistance

private static int convertDistance(double radius,
                                   double distance)
This method converts an angle to actual wheel movement distance.

Parameters:
radius - the radius of the wheel
distance - the distance between the wheels.
Returns:
the distance that has been calculated

convertAngle

private static int convertAngle(double radius,
                                double width,
                                double angle)
This method converts a wheel distance to the equivalent agnle in terms of wheel rotation.

Parameters:
radius - the radius of the wheel
width - the distance between the wheels
angle - the angle we wish to convert
Returns:
conversion from angle to wheel rotation distance

setCurrentCoordinates

private void setCurrentCoordinates()
This method is used after the midpoints localization to set the x and y to their exact values.
